intro: Cnidoscolus lobatus, commonly known as the arrow leaf balsam, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with lobed margins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its stems and leaves contain irritant chemicals, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
